Description: Upper body of glazed composition (faience) stirrup-jar (repaired from five fragments); the complete vessel was mould-made in two pieces, with spout and handles added separately; lower body, neck and handles now lost; the glaze is very worn and has lost all its colour; traces of black-brown painted decoration have survived: parts of a band at the juncture of the upper and lower parts of the body; traces of dots survive as patches of eroded glaze around the body.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Cyprus
Curator's comments: Provenance unknown, but almost certainly from one of the Late Bronze Age sites excavated by the Turner Bequest (Kourion, Enkomi), or perhaps some of the sites explored later in the 1890s (Maroni, Hala Sultan tekke or Klavdhia).
